title: What is the relationship between magic and science in understanding natural laws and causality?
first_phrase: In the previous text, the author argues that until scientists have a complete understanding of all the causes that influence a phenomenon, they cannot claim that those causes are laws. The text also raises the issue of the limits of science, even as it has achieved unification and deduction of physical laws. In the last 200 tokens, the author explores the difference between magic and the practical application of science. The author argues that while magic and science both use natural laws to achieve their goals, magic implies an unconditional realization that would bypass natural laws.
